Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: ACG 2021 and ECO 2013 or ECO 2023 each with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better, and consent of Honors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction to the theory and practice of managing formal organizations, including planning, organization theory, human behavior, and control. Applicable to honors students.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: ACG 2021 and ECO 2013 or ECO 2023 each with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better, or for non-business majors, ECO 2013 or ECO 2023 with a grade of "C" (2.0) or better.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduction to the theory and practice of managing formal organizations, including planning, organization theory, human behavior and control.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Completion of MAN 3025 and students admitted into any of the restricted business majors.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Completion of MAN 3025 and students admitted into any of the restricted business majors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A course providing a micro/macro approach to the study of organizations by integrating organizational theory and organizational behavioral science concepts.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to the Management major, Technological Entrepreneurship Minor, Entrepreneurship Minor or Entrepreneurship Certificate program.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Provides a foundation on the leadership development process and the impact leaders can have on individuals, groups, and organizations.

MAN4320 - Human Resources Recruitment an.name: MAN4320 - Human Resources Recruitment and Selection

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAN 3301 or MAN 3302

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A concentrated investigation of the methods appropriate to the development, implementation and administration of the staffing process in contemporary organizations

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to the Integrated Business major or Management major.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Foundations of project management in assorted organizations and industries. Covers the project environment, the project manager's role, and project phases from initiation to closing.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Sophomore standing and ENC 1102

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Provides students with a complete, comprehensive review of the strategic importance of the essential human resource management concepts and techniques for any student majoring in Management.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAN 3301 or MAN 3302

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Presentation of compensation theory and current pay related issues and their application to the design and administration of pay systems in large and small organizations

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAN 3301 or MAN 3302

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The management of worker performance through the training and development activities delivered by organizational specialists. Theory, issues, practices and problems are discussed.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Completion of MAN 3025 and students admitted into any of the restricted business majors.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: Completion of MAN 3025 and students admitted into any of the restricted business majors.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Conflict resolution and negotiation theories and processes applied to human resource management practices and other management activities in work organizations.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Approved major or minor, MAN 3025.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The course examines issues involved in multinational management of business firms, with special emphasis on comparative management.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admitted to Business major, senior standing, admitted to Honors College and completion of: MAN 3025, MAR 3023, FIN 3403, QMB 3200, and ACG 3173 or ACG 3131.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Students assume a strategic view of organizations and integrate and apply material learned in their business courses to modern organizational problems and opportunities.  Applicable to honors students.

MAN4046 - Teamwork, Collaboration, and G.name: MAN4046 - Teamwork, Collaboration, and Group Dynamics

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to the Management major, Technological Entrepreneurship Minor, Entrepreneurship Minor or Entrepreneurship Certificate program

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examination of concepts related to teams and group dynamics, and development of an understanding of how to become an effective team member, leader, and designer.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admitted to Business major, senior standing, and completion of MAN 3025, MAR 3023, FIN 3403, QMB 3200, and ACG 3173 or ACG 3131.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Students assume a strategic view of organizations and integrate and apply material learned in their business courses to modern organizational problems and opportunities.

MAN4329 - Business Analytics in Human Re.name: MAN4329 - Business Analytics in Human Resource Management

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAN 3301 or MAN 3302

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Processes, methodologies, infrastructure, and current practices used to transform data from many sources into useful information for human resource management and decisions.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Management major, application approval, consent of department chair.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Provides student with supervised, management-related work experience in a sponsoring organization. See department for information; application required.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Admission to the Management major.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Explores how innovative organization design represents an important source of competitive advantage for organizations of all types.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: MAN 3025. Management Majors and Minors and students whose major requires it.

Prerequisites/Corequisites.title: Prerequisites/Corequisites
Prerequisites/Corequisites.text: MAN 3025. Management Majors and Minors and students whose major requires it.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Principles and theories of quality and operations management in manufacturing and service organizations.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Management major, MAN 3025.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: This course applies the ethics dimension to business decisions in today's complex political, social, economic and technological environment.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Management major, MAN 3025.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: The study of individual, interpersonal, group, and intergroup problems in business organizations through the use of cases and experimental exercises.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Senior standing and C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Business students will team with engineering students to obtain hands on experience at solving real world design problems in a team based environment.

MAN3302 - Essentials of Human Resource M.name: MAN3302 - Essentials of Human Resource Management for Integrated Business

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Completion of MAN 3025 with a grade of "C" or better

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Prepares managers to contribute to the development and implementation of HR policies and practices. Legal issues and relationships with other business functions are emphasized.
